node.title: Buzz off — getting ready for mosquito 'explosion'
node.description: Mosquitoes love the kind of weather Australia is offering at the moment and look set for a bumper summer. Here's why breeding conditions are ideal and the best way to prepare.
node.content:
["It's been a wet spring, and November may turn out to be one of the wettest on record.\u00a0", "The Bureau of Meteorology is predicting summer will also bring above-average rainfall for parts of the eastern states, and a 70 per cent chance of La\u00a0Ni\u00f1a forming in the coming months.", "With waterways swelling, David Bock from the Australia Museum told ABC Radio Hobart\u00a0it\u00a0would be\u00a0perfect conditions for mosquitoes.", "", "
The Belubula River at Canowindra in New South Wales\u00a0last week.(ABC Central West: Joanna Woodburn)
", "\"When you get a lot of standing\u00a0water and the warmer weather, you will get mosquito numbers exploding,\" Mr Bock said.", "\"Mosquitoes are a species that can breed up very quickly.", "\"But\u00a0it can also lead to big numbers of species that eat mosquitoes.\"", "Mr Bock said it wasn't just water\u00a0that was needed for mosquitoes to thrive, but warm temperatures as well.", "The cold snap Tasmania recently experienced with snow almost down to sea level would have killed off larvae, he said.", "In other areas of Australia where it has\u00a0been warm, he noted the situation is very different.", "", "
Only female mosquitoes are hungry for human blood.(Flickr: James Gathany)
", "
The mosquito life cycle
", "Mr Bock said mosquitoes lay eggs on stagnant water and the nymphs\u00a0or \"wrigglers\"\u00a0have an aquatic stage in\u00a0their life cycle.", "The larvae\u00a0are up against predators like frogs, fish and other insects.", "\"When there's lots of food around, the predators do well as well,\" he said.", "When there is lots of water\u00a0on the ground and in gutters and backyard plant containers, mosquitoes have opportunities to avoid predators and quickly multiply.", "\"That's when you'll get the population booming when there's a lot of freestanding water,\" he said.", "The wrigglers spend about a week in the water before being able to fly off.", "If the water dries up, they die.", "", "
The Jordan River broke\u00a0its banks in southern Tasmania recently.(Supplied : Andrew Jones)
", "
Only females bite
", "Mr Bock says\u00a0only a small portion of mosquito species are out looking for blood.", "\"There are many species of mosquitoes, and many aren't pests at all,\" he said.", "\"Most drink nectar and sugar off flowers and plants.\"", "Of the species that do want blood, it is only the females who bite.", "\"In a world without people, these mosquitoes would have fed off birds and mammals.\"", "\"But humans happen to be another source of nutrition for these females.\"", "He says\u00a0disease becomes a problem when mosquitoes feed on multiple sources of blood, and blood gets mixed between humans and animals.", "
Mosquito-borne diseases
", "Ross River virus is the most common mosquito-borne disease\u00a0and can be found everywhere in Australia but is most prevalent in\u00a0Queensland, the Northern Territory and the Kimberley region of Western Australia.", "Public health physician\u00a0Rod McClure told ABC Sunshine Coast symptoms develop about 10 days after a bite\u00a0and can last for months.", "\"Some people don't develop symptoms at all, but quite a few have flu-like symptoms, fever, chills and headaches associated with rashes and aches and pains in joints,\" he said.", "He said joint stiffness could become debilitating.", "Dr McClure says\u00a0there is no specific treatment for Ross River virus, but its symptoms can be managed.", "The biggest risk of getting the virus is over summer.", "\"It's starting to increase now so we are just before the rise, and from January to March you see a dramatic escalation and then it returns to baseline,\" he said.", "", "
Rod McClure\u00a0says the best way to avoid mosquito bites is to cover up.(Supplied: Unsplash)
", "
Protecting yourself
", "Dr McClure\u00a0encouraged people to install and maintain fly screens,\u00a0use insect repellent\u00a0outside and be conscious of mosquitoes\u00a0in the early morning and evenings.", "\"Protect your skin with clothes the mosquitoes are unable to bite through,\" he said.", "He said loose and long light-coloured clothing\u00a0was\u00a0best.", "The Barmah Forest virus is also found in most regions of Australia and\u00a0has similar symptoms to Ross River virus.", "Malaria and dengue fever are\u00a0not transmitted in Australia, with all cases coming from overseas."]
